Giorgia Meloni: Neo-fascist or far right? Why Italian PM's tenure raises questions among political experts
subhed: The Italian prime minister has been in power now for three years. Italy's political experts question the normalization of this leader, who comes from a neo-fascist background. Has her tenure really been accompanied by a moderation of her political views?

'In Spain, the Sánchez government holds on, but its future appears seriously in doubt'
subhed: The Iberian Peninsula's economy is thriving, yet the absence of a budget since 2023 has exposed the deep-seated tensions in Spanish political life and does not rule out general elections being held in 2026, writes historian Benoît Pellistrandi in an op-ed for Le Monde.

title: In Austria, the rebellion of three nuns from the Goldenstein convent
subhed: The sisters claim they were financially stripped and forced to leave their religious establishment to move into a nursing home. Thanks to the support of volunteers, they have 'escaped' and have since returned to their former monastery.

title: In 'Avatar: Fire and Ash,' James Cameron's Na'vi lose faith
subhed: The third installment of the saga on the planet Pandora finds its inhabitants transformed into nihilist punks, ready to collaborate with their human colonizers.

title: Madagascar's metalheads lead charge of anger: 'It's easier to make yourself heard when you scream'
subhed: After three weeks of protest, Madagascar's Generation Z succeeded in toppling those in power on October 14. The uprising drew much of its strength from countercultural circles, chief among them the island's vibrant metal scene. Heirs to a long tradition, Madagascar's metalheads condemn poverty, inequality and the regime's incompetence.

subhed: After a joint committee failed to reach an agreement on France's contentious budget bill, the government plans to present a special law on Monday to ensure the continuity of the state.
